trans-unit.source: Schedules in Azure Automation | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Schedules in Azure Automation | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Automation schedules are used to schedule runbooks in Azure Automation to start automatically.
trans-unit.target: Automation schedules are used to schedule runbooks in Azure Automation to start automatically.

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to create schedules.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to create schedules.

trans-unit.source: Schedules in Azure Automation
trans-unit.target: Schedules in Azure Automation

trans-unit.source: Automation Schedules are used to schedule runbooks to run automatically.
trans-unit.target: Automation Schedules are used to schedule runbooks to run automatically.

trans-unit.source: This could be either a single date and time for the runbook to run once.
trans-unit.target: This could be either a single date and time for the runbook to run once.

trans-unit.source: Or it could be a recurring schedule to start the runbook multiple times.
trans-unit.target: Or it could be a recurring schedule to start the runbook multiple times.

trans-unit.source: Schedules are typically not accessed from runbooks.
trans-unit.target: Schedules are typically not accessed from runbooks.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell Cmdlets
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell Cmdlets

trans-unit.source: The cmdlets in the following table are used to create and manage variables with Windows PowerShell in Azure Automation.
trans-unit.target: The cmdlets in the following table are used to create and manage variables with Windows PowerShell in Azure Automation.

trans-unit.source: They ship as part of the [Azure PowerShell module](../powershell-install-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: They ship as part of the [Azure PowerShell module](../powershell-install-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: Cmdlets
trans-unit.target: Cmdlets

trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureAutomationSchedule
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureAutomationSchedule

trans-unit.source: Retrieves a schedule.
trans-unit.target: Retrieves a schedule.

trans-unit.target: New-AzureAutomationSchedule

trans-unit.target: Creates a new schedule.

trans-unit.target: Remove-AzureAutomationSchedule

trans-unit.target: Removes a schedule.

trans-unit.target: Set-AzureAutomationSchedule

trans-unit.source: Sets the properties for an existing schedule.
trans-unit.target: Sets the properties for an existing schedule.

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureAutomationScheduledRunbook
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureAutomationScheduledRunbook

trans-unit.source: Retrieves scheduled runbooks.
trans-unit.target: Retrieves scheduled runbooks.

trans-unit.source: Register-AzureAutomationScheduledRunbook
trans-unit.target: Register-AzureAutomationScheduledRunbook

trans-unit.source: Associates a runbook with a schedule.
trans-unit.target: Associates a runbook with a schedule.

trans-unit.source: Unregister-AzureAutomationScheduledRunbook
trans-unit.target: Unregister-AzureAutomationScheduledRunbook

trans-unit.source: Dissociates a runbook from a schedule.
trans-unit.target: Dissociates a runbook from a schedule.

trans-unit.source: Creating a new Schedule
trans-unit.target: Creating a new Schedule

trans-unit.source: To create a new schedule with the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: To create a new schedule with the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: From your automation account, click **Assets** at the top of the window.
trans-unit.target: From your automation account, click **Assets** at the top of the window.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the window, click **Add Setting**.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the window, click **Add Setting**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add Schedule**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add Schedule**.

trans-unit.source: Complete the wizard and click the checkbox to save the new variable.
trans-unit.target: Complete the wizard and click the checkbox to save the new variable.

trans-unit.source: To create a new schedule with the Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: To create a new schedule with the Azure preview portal

trans-unit.source: From your automation account, click the **Assets** part to open the **Assets** blade.
trans-unit.target: From your automation account, click the **Assets** part to open the **Assets** blade.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Schedules** part to open the **Schedules** blade.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Schedules** part to open the **Schedules** blade.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add a Schedule** at the top of the blade.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add a Schedule** at the top of the blade.

trans-unit.source: Complete the form and click **Create** to save the new schedule.
trans-unit.target: Complete the form and click **Create** to save the new schedule.

trans-unit.source: To create a new schedule with Windows PowerShell
trans-unit.target: To create a new schedule with Windows PowerShell

trans-unit.source: The [New-AzureAutomationSchedule](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn690271.aspx) cmdlet creates a new schedule and sets the value for an existing schedule.
trans-unit.target: The [New-AzureAutomationSchedule](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn690271.aspx) cmdlet creates a new schedule and sets the value for an existing schedule.

trans-unit.source: The following sample Windows PowerShell commands create a new schedule called My Daily Schedule that starts on tomorrow at noon and fires every day one year:
trans-unit.target: The following sample Windows PowerShell commands create a new schedule called My Daily Schedule that starts on tomorrow at noon and fires every day one year:
